results.name: Triangle read by rows giving successive states of one-dimensional cellular automaton generated by "Rule 110".
comment: New state of cell is 1 in every case except when the previous states of the cell and its two neighbors were all the same, or when the left neighbor was 1 and the cell and its right neighbor were both 0.
A cellular automaton using Rule 110 with arbitrary inputs is a universal Turing machine.
reference: S. Wolfram, A New Kind of Science, Wolfram Media, 2002; p. 31ff..
